results.title: Over-dependency
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The case history of a man whose life is crippled by behavior patterns carried over from a too-dependent childhood. Through therapy he comes to understand the causes of his illness and fear.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Outside the golden ring
results.creator_credit: George Lindsey and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: Studies the non-traditional marriages of today - homosexual, older-younger, black-white and the unmarrieds. It opens with a sequence inside a gay bar in Washington, D.C. as two homosexuals tell about their marriage. Other participants in the non-traditional marriages are also interviewed. The film examines the life styles and frustration’s of these marriages and includes analysis and comments by two psychologists and a marriage counsellor.

results.title: Outlook: the line
results.creator_credit: Christopher McGill, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film was made to commemorate the first crossing of Australia by the standard gauge railway line between Sydney and Perth. It does not attempt to trace this trip, rather, it attempts to capture the spirit of the crossing, the flashes of raw colour as the bleak but beautiful Australian landscape rips past crossing the endless unbroken space of nowhere.

results.title: Deadly
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Richard Moir, Beyond Films and Moirstorm Productions
results.brief_description: To clear his name, disgraced city cop Tony Bourke (Jerome Ehlers) is sent to file a report on the “suicide” hanging of a local First Nations person in a remote outback gaol. His orders are to clean things up quickly and quietly but, in a town ready to explode with racial tension, Bourke uncovers a web of suspicion and the truth behind a deadly secret. A fast-paced thriller and intriguing and powerful story of conspiracy, cover-up and cold-blooded murder. Features Tony Barry and Bill Hunter.

results.title: Death flight 901: the Erebus disaster
results.creator_credit: John Keir, New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation and Sonar Productions
results.brief_description: A film about the Air New Zealand DC10 plane crash at Mt Erebus in Antarctica on November 28, 1979 and the judicial process of apportioning blame. Includes footage of the wreckage and sequences filmed inside the courtroom at the Royal Commission of Inquiry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Keir, New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation and Sonar Productions

results.title: Deadlock
results.brief_description: The film starts when Anna (played by Kerry Fox) has called the police to arrest her defacto Serge (played by Raj Sidhu). The film explores their relationship and how the violent tendencies of Serge develop and worsen over time. The line has been crossed. What was frustration and anger has been revealed to be a pattern of violent behaviour. Anna observes this and decides to take action, albeit not soon enough.

results.title: Deadline
results.creator_credit: Nash Edgerton and Blue Tongue Films
results.brief_description: Drummoyne 4.50 pm - a young man races across various Sydney suburbs, headed for Kings Cross, at a furiously reckless pace. Accompanied by a rocking punk-skater soundtrack this Australian short film amuses greatly with its almost dialogue-less encounters and frenetic pace. Cast includes Nash Edgerton and John Polson.

results.title: Death and destiny: a Journey into Ancient Egypt
results.brief_description: At Saqqara, just south of the Great Pyramids, lies what is arguably the most important archaeological site in Egypt. At this site, the careful excavation work and detective cunning of an Australian archaeologist has uncovered clues to the assassination of a Pharaoh; a plot that involved court officials, the Pharaoh’s bodyguard and harem. Narrated by Phillip Adams.

results.title: Dead set
results.brief_description: The Australian music scene is presented here by producer/writer/director Rob Payne in an entertaining and fascinating way. Includes live performances from popular Australian bands; Spiderbait, You Am I, Powderfinger, Ammonia, Jebediah, Frenzal Rhomb, Bodyjar, Regurgitator, Crow, Custard, Grinspoon, Something for Kate and Augie March. Interspersed with the performances are insights by band members and recognised industry heavyweights Richard Kingsmill and Damien Lovelock. Material covered includes; Attitude; covering the influence of the American grunge scene, Australia’s geographical isolation and what sounds Australian; Cross Over; the inability to define Australian music by a specific genre and the cross over between mainstream, alternative and punk; Influences; discusses how different influences contribute to Australian music’s diverse sound; Live; the quite healthy existence of the live scene; Festivals; the importance of festivals such as the Big Day Out, Homebake, The Falls and what it means to performers and spectators; JJJ; the influence of ‘The Australian Music Show’ and Unearthed; Lyrics; how song lyrics come about, or in some cases, don’t; Overdrive; a candid discussion of behind the scenes activities, such as accommodation and parties. A fascinating documentary that will appeal to fans of the band as well as anyone with an interest in Australian music.

results.title: Dead reckoning
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Sidney Biddell and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart is at his best as a hard-boiled sleuth in this ‘40s film noir classic. He plays Rip Murdock, an ex-GI trying to discover who framed his pal, Johnny, for murder and then rubbed him out. Tracing his war buddy’s shadowy past leads Rip to Coral Chandler (Lizabeth Scott), who was once Johnny’s sweetheart and is now a chanteuse in a nightclub run by a brutal gangster, Martinelli (Morris Carnovsky). Rip gets a taste of the beautiful blonde’s seductive charms and soon finds himself ensnared in a twisted web of deceit and danger.
